title: Relative velocity - stone thrown from a train

content.question: An observer standing on the ground measures the speed of a train as <math alttext="v sub T equals 18 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>T</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> to the right. Relative to the observer, a stone is launched upward and to the left with a speed <math alttext="v sub S equals 10 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>S</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta equals 45 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> from the horizontal, as shown in the figure. What is the speed at which the stone was launched relative to the train?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
